Andy Burnham said Michael Gove was encouraging a "dog-eat-dog world" and said students had the right to study subjects that interest them most . He said Michael Gove was "inflicting an ideological experiment" on pupils.He said the Michael Government's flagship free schools were being approved without consultation with people who live nearby, while "existing local schools are being left to

so much trouble that it's very easy to imagine that they would show up and ask for more money," Newt Gingrich said. Bill Lockyer , the California treasurer, said those who support the idea want one thing above all-- to see government go up in flames and, with it, the lives of a certain class of working people they don't like.
